text.p: In this exercise, you are tasked to complete your own implementation of the method powerN(int, int) in the class PowerCalculator. This method calculates the non-negative integer power of an integer number. The method takes in two int paramaters, number and power. It then calculates the result of raising the number to the given power and returns the calculated result. If a negative power is given, the method simply returns 1.

The BlueJ project for this exercise can be downloaded here. You are encouraged to try your code on BlueJ first before submitting the answer online. To run the method, right click on the PowerCalculator class and click on the long powerN(int number, int power) method. Enter the values for the parameters number and power in the pop up dialog and click Ok. The calculated result will be shown in another pop up dialog.
